ExplicitLayout
3.0

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.zookitec.layout
Class ExplicitConstraints

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.zookitec.layout.ExplicitConstraints
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
public class ExplicitConstraints
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

This class contains expressions that define the location and size of a component.

The location of a java.awt.Component is usually specified using the (x, y) coordinate of its top-left corner. This class defines a component's location using expressions for the x and y coordinates of some point on the component defined as the component origin. The component origin is specified as fractions of the component's width and height. This is typically used to align the LEFT, RIGHT, TOP, BOTTOM or CENTER of a group of components; constants have been conveniently defined for this purpose.

The size of the component is specified as a width and a height expression. The methods setWidthZeroIfInvisible and setHeightZeroIfInvisible are used to set flags which determine whether the width and height is set to zero if the component is not visible, regardless of the value of the corresponding expression. For example, these flags could be used to determine whether components shuffle up to fill the gap when a component is made invisible.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

ExplicitConstraints

public ExplicitConstraints(java.awt.Component component)
Constructs a new ExplicitConstraints object for the specified component.

The attributes are initialised using defaults as follows:

  • X = ContainerEF.left()
  • Y = ContainerEF.top()
  • Width = null;
    this indicates to constructor that the component's preferred width is default
  • Height = null;
    this indicates to constructor that the component's preferred height is default
  • OriginX = LEFT
  • OriginY = TOP
  • WidthZeroIfInvisible = true
  • HeightZeroIfInvisible = true

Parameters:
component - the component; this cannot be null.

ExplicitConstraints

public ExplicitConstraints(java.awt.Component component,
                           java.lang.String name)
Constructs a new ExplicitConstraints object for the specified component. The attributes are initialised using defaults as specified in the no-args constructor. This constructor is intended for use when a ConstraintsSource is used to define the constraints; the name is used to identify the component.

Parameters:
component - the component; this cannot be null.
name - the name of the component.

ExplicitConstraints

public ExplicitConstraints(java.awt.Component component,
                           Expression x,
                           Expression y,
                           Expression width,
                           Expression height,
                           double originX,
                           double originY,
                           boolean widthZero,
                           boolean heightZero)
Constructs a new ExplicitConstraints object for the specified component using the specified attributes.

Parameters:
x - the expression for the x coordinate of the component's origin.
y - the expression for the y coordinate of the component's origin.
width - the expression for the component's width or null for preferred width.
height - the expression for the component's height or null for preferred height.
originX - the origin x coordinate fraction in the range 0 .. 1 inclusive.
originY - the origin y coordinate fraction in the range 0 .. 1 inclusive.
widthZero - true if width is zero when component is not visible.
heightZero - true if height is zero when component is not visible.

ExplicitConstraints

public ExplicitConstraints(java.awt.Component component,
                           Expression x,
                           Expression y)

ExplicitConstraints

public ExplicitConstraints(java.awt.Component component,
                           Expression x,
                           Expression y,
                           Expression width,
                           Expression height)

ExplicitConstraints

public ExplicitConstraints(java.awt.Component component,
                           Expression left,
                           Expression top,
                           Expression widthOrRight,
                           boolean isWidth,
                           Expression heightOrBottom,
                           boolean isHeight)
Constructs a new ExplicitConstraints object for the specified component using the specified attributes.

The boolean flags allow you to specify the following combinations of width, right, height and bottom:

  • width, height
  • width, bottom
  • right, height
  • right, bottom

They are also necessary to distinguish the constructor signature from the x,y,width,height constructor.

Parameters:
left - the expression for the component's left x coordinate.
top - the expression for the component's top y coordinate.
widthOrRight - the expression for the component's width or right x coordinate depending on isWidth.
isWidth - true if widthOrRight specifies width; false if widthOrRight specifies right. *
isHeight - true if heightOrBottom specifies height; false if heightOrBottom specifies bottom.
Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Gets a name used to identify a component in a ConstraintsSource.

Returns:
the component name or null if name not specified.

getComponent

public java.awt.Component getComponent()
Gets the component whose size and location are defined by this constraints object. This may return null if this is a default constraints object created using the no-args constructor.

Returns:
the component

setX

public void setX(Expression x)
Sets the expression for the x coordinate of the component's origin.

Parameters:
x - the expression for the x coordinate of the component's origin.

setY

public void setY(Expression y)
Sets the expression for the y coordinate of the component's origin.

Parameters:
y - the expression for the y coordinate of the component's origin.

setWidth

public void setWidth(Expression width)
Sets the expression for the component's width.

Warning: This width expression should not be dependent on the component's x coordinate if originX != 0.0. This is because the x coordinate is dependent on the width expression if originX != 0.0. Such a circular definition will result in a stack overflow error.

If the width expression is null, an expression for the component's preferred width is used. This overrides any previous call to setRight.

Parameters:
width - the expression for the component's width

setHeight

public void setHeight(Expression height)
Sets the expression for the component's height.

Warning: This height expression should not be dependent on the component's y coordinate if originY != 0.0. This is because the y coordinate is dependent on the width expression if originY != 0.0. Such a circular definition will result in a stack overflow error.

If the height expression is null, an expression for the component's preferred height is used. This overrides any previous call to setBottom.

Parameters:
height - the expression for the component's height.

setRight

public void setRight(Expression right)
Sets the expression for the component's right x coordinate. This is an alternative to specifying the width expression.

setBottom

public void setBottom(Expression bottom)
Sets the expression for the component's bottom y coordinate and sets originY to TOP. This is an alternative to specifying the height expression.

setWidthZeroIfInvisible

public void setWidthZeroIfInvisible(boolean flag)
This flag influences the value returned by getWidthValue() depending on whether the component is visible.

Parameters:
flag - the value of the flag
See Also:
getWidthValue(ExplicitLayout)

getXValue

public int getXValue(ExplicitLayout layout)
Gets the x coordinate value for the top-left corner of the component.

This is used by ExplicitLayout to set the component's location.

Parameters:
layout - the explicit layout containing this constraints object
Returns:
the x coordinate value

getYValue

public int getYValue(ExplicitLayout layout)
Gets the y coordinate value for the top-left corner of the component.

This is used by ExplicitLayout to set the component's location.

Parameters:
layout - the explicit layout containing this constraints object
Returns:
the y coordinate value

getWidthValue

public int getWidthValue(ExplicitLayout layout)
Gets the width value for the component.

If widthZeroIfInvisible flag is true, this gets the value of the width expression if the component is visible and 0 if the component is not visible.
If widthZeroIfInvisible flag is false, this gets the value of the width expression regardless of whether the component is visible or not.

This is used by ExplicitLayout to set the component's width.

Parameters:
layout - the explicit layout containing this constraints object
Returns:
the width value

getHeightValue

public int getHeightValue(ExplicitLayout layout)
Gets the height value for the component.

If heightZeroIfInvisible flag is true, this gets the value of the height expression if the component is visible and 0 if the component is not visible.
If heightZeroIfInvisible flag is false, this gets the value of the height expression regardless of whether the component is visible or not.

This is used by ExplicitLayout to set the component's height.

Parameters:
layout - the explicit layout containing this constraints object
Returns:
the height value

setOriginX

public void setOriginX(double originX)
Sets the origin x coordinate as a fraction of the component's width. OriginX cannot be set to anything other than LEFT if a right X expression is specified.

Parameters:
originX - the origin x coordinate fraction in the range 0 .. 1 inclusive. The constants LEFT, CENTER and RIGHT can be used.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if originX is out of range.

getOriginX

public double getOriginX()
Gets the origin x coordinate fraction.

Returns:
the origin x coordinate fraction.

setOriginY

public void setOriginY(double originY)
Sets the origin y coordinate as a fraction of the component's height. OriginY cannot be set to anything other than TOP if a bottom X expression is specified.

Parameters:
originY - the origin y coordinate fraction in the range 0 .. 1 inclusive. The constants TOP, CENTER and BOTTOM can be used.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if originY is out of range.

getOriginY

public double getOriginY()
Gets the origin y coordinate fraction.

Returns:
the origin y coordinate fraction.

invalidate

protected void invalidate()
Invalidate the the x, y, width and height expressions.

restoreDefaults

public void restoreDefaults()

copy

public void copy(ExplicitConstraints other)
Copies the attributes from some other constraints object to this. This copies the x, y, width and height, originX, originY, widthZeroIfInvisible and heightZeroIfInvisible attributes. It does not copy the component or name attribute.

Parameters:
other - some other constraints object
